wikipedia_page.main: Walter Nurnberg   (April 18, 1907 – 19 October 1991) was one of post-war Britain's outstanding industrial photographers.

response: In London, (Florence) Louise Clarke Aldred (1910–1997) was head of textiles from 1939.Elain Harwood, ‘Bennett, Sir Hubert (1909–2000)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, Oct 2012; online edn, Jan 2013 accessed 20 Jan 2013  Stanley Herbert taught poster design and another poster designer, Austin Cooper, was principal. Other staff included Walter Nurnberg (a student from the Berlin school), Richard Hamilton, Leonard Rosoman, Eric Fraser, Milner GrayGeoffrey V. Adams, ‘Gray, Milner Connorton (1899–1997)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, May 2010 accessed 20 Jan 2013  and Merlyn Evans.
*Walter Nurnberg, Head, Guildford School of Photography, West Surrey College of Art and Design. For services to industrial photography.
